channel.title: VPS Set-up
channel.description:
I'm interested in buying a windows vps for my server, atm I don't have the money but I have 10 dollars donated on my first day of release and I want to be ready once I have the correct amount of money.
Basically, all I'm asking for is a detailed (not to picky ;D) tut or step by step guide on how to set up a windows vps. The website I am planning buy the vps from is www.vpsland.com but if the tutorial is based on another website that is fine. As long as it works and is safe.
I will greatly appreciate the help from any of you who know, it doesnt have to be made by you, you can send me a link.. Although, I HAVE SEARCHED FROM GOOGLE, AND I HAVE SEARCHED WITH THE SEARCH BAR.
So none of that "ohh try google huhuhuhuh" :P

item.title: VPS Set-up
item.dc:creator: @Skorge Skorge
item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

[quote=“syracusepker94, post:11, topic:313844”][quote author=busta123 link=topic=410341.msg3031600#msg3031600 date=1258420310]
why not get someone to host for you? or are you worried about if they take your server?
I can host for you 24/7 a month free as long as i get admin or above. up to you ofcoarse.
[/quote]

umm… do you want me to help code your server or what? im very bored[/quote]

I need help setting up this vps, coding is fine for now, if you know how to do this, add me on MSN: ryan.darius@yahoo.com

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Set-up
item.dc:creator: @Skorge Skorge
item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:7, topic:313844”]Nice, now all you have to do is run the server on your VPS.
You can transfer your source files via www.megaupload.com, or some other upload service.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 12, 2009, 08:53:48 pm[/size][hr][quote author=Skorge link=topic=410341.msg3027131#msg3027131 date=1258080450]
Well atm, I have no-ip (the server is running from my computer atm)
I have firefox (you are completely right)
and I have java (…of course)
I have a big warm hug from all of you (kisses too)

P.S: It says to type in user and pass once I enter in ip… What shall I put in?
[/quote]You put in Administrator as the user and the password is what you signed up with @ vpsland.com[/quote]

Thanks, but when I did that it says

This computer cannot connect with the remote computer

Try again, if it continues, contact the owner etc.etc.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Set-up
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Skype™, post:4, topic:313844”]They will indeed set up the VPS for you then you must connect to it using ‘Remote Desktop’ (Start - Run - MSTSC) When ‘Remote Desktop’ pops up type in the IP address then you should connect. Usually you will need to install Java, No-Ip, and FireFox (not needed I find it better then IE).[/quote]Definatly because the IE has AN ASSLOAD of restrictions. It takes a while to get rid of all those restrictions so I would just switch to Google Chrome or Firefox.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Set-up
item.dc:creator: @Skype1 Skype™
item.description:
@Skype1 wrote:

They will indeed set up the VPS for you then you must connect to it using ‘Remote Desktop’ (Start - Run - MSTSC) When ‘Remote Desktop’ pops up type in the IP address then you should connect. Usually you will need to install Java, No-Ip, and FireFox (not needed I find it better then IE).

Read full topic
